Package com.panasonic.toughpad.android.api.appbtn

Allows control of the customizable buttons on the device, such as the A1, A2, A3, side, and user buttons.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AppButtonManager
    AppButtonManager can be used to control the application buttons on the Android device.

Package com.panasonic.toughpad.android.api.appbtn Description

Allows control of the customizable buttons on the device, such as the A1, A2, A3, side, and user buttons.

An application that wishes to receive application button events must have an exported service defined in its AndroidManifest.xml that has the following intent filter:

 <action android:name="com.panasonic.toughpad.android.api.appbutton.intent.APPBUTTON"/>

The user must choose a single application to control all of the buttons on the device via the "Button Handler" utility, only applications that have the exported service with the intent filter mentioned above will be available to be chosen. An application can call AppButtonManager.hasButtonControl() to determine if it is currently in control of application buttons. If it is not in control, the application can ask the user to assign button control to it by opening the "Button Handler" activity: 

 Intent reconfigureApp = new Intent(Intent.ACTION_MAIN);
 reconfigureApp.addCategory(Intent.CATEGORY_LAUNCHER);
 reconfigureApp.setFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK);
 reconfigureApp.setComponent(new ComponentName("com.panasonic.toughpad.android.service",
                                               "com.panasonic.toughpad.android.appbuttondelegator.ConfigActivity"));
 startActivity(reconfigureApp);
The user can then select the application they desire to control buttons.

The intent sent to the service is defined as follows:

  • Action: AppButtonManager.ACTION_APPBUTTON.
  • Button Type Extra: AppButtonManager.EXTRA_APPBUTTON_BUTTON.
  • Button Type Value: One of the BUTTON_*** constants in AppButtonManager.
  • Button State Extra: AppButtonManager.EXTRA_APPBUTTON_STATE.
  • Button State Value: Either AppButtonManager.EXTRA_APPBUTTON_STATE_DOWN or AppButtonManager.EXTRA_APPBUTTON_STATE_UP.
